beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: B:Our rates are $10.00 a day and 10 cents a mile.
sentences.chinese: 我们的租费一天10美元，每英里10美分钱。

sentences.chinese: 普通股摊薄后每股盈利为55美分。

sentences.english: Instant noodles, which Chinese like to eat dry, were thirty cents.
sentences.chinese: 中国人喜欢干吃的方便面，只要30美分。

sentences.english: Iv He had uncombed hair, dirty clothes, and only 35 cents in his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他头发凌乱，衣衫肮脏，口袋里仅有35美分。

sentences.english: Corn shot up to seventy-three cents a bushel.
sentences.chinese: 谷物猛涨到一蒲式耳七十三美分。

sentences.english: Wu said she makes just a few cents on each one.
sentences.chinese: 吴女士说她从每个呜呜祖啦上仅仅赚几美分。

sentences.english: Then she cut him half of her ten-cent cake.
sentences.chinese: 接着她把自己用十美分买的蛋糕切了一半给他。

sentences.english: A half-dollar is worth fifty cents.
Analysts had forecast a 56-cent profit, according to a Bloomberg survey.
sentences.chinese: 据彭博社调查显示，此前分析师预测利润为56美分。

sentences.english: She paid 65 cents an hour and I could start that night.
sentences.chinese: 她可以付一小时65美分而我可以今晚就开始工作。

sentences.english: Taxes on a six-pack of beer would jump from 33 cents to 81 cents, for example.
sentences.chinese: 六瓶装的啤酒的税负从33美分提高到81美分。

sentences.chinese: 六瓶装的啤酒的税负从33美分提高到81美分。
他们把十美分抹掉了，不找给我。

sentences.english: and it's 30 cents more than the non-organic.
sentences.chinese: 会看到它的价格比别的非有机苹果贵30美分。
